keyword: how many calories in a protein shake
title: How Many Calories in a Protein Shake?
meta_description: Discover how many calories in a protein shake, including protein, carbs, fat, and full nutrition breakdown for a standard serving with skim milk.
h1: How Many Calories in a Protein Shake?
assumptions: Standard whey protein shake: 1 scoop (30g) unflavored powder mixed with 240ml skim milk, no added sweeteners or fruits.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by brand, protein type, milk choice, additives, and serving size. Check product labels for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A typical protein shake provides ~220 kcal and ~30 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts fields for easy comparison.

tweaks.label: Mix with water instead of skim milk
Use whole milk instead of skim

faqs.q: How many calories in a protein shake with water?
faqs.a: About 120-140 kcal for 1 scoop powder mixed with water, depending on the brand.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in a protein shake?
faqs.a: Typically 20-30 g per serving; our basis assumes 30 g.

faqs.q: Do protein shakes have a lot of sugar?
faqs.a: Varies—whey isolate with water has ~1 g; with milk, ~12 g from lactose.

faqs.q: How many calories in a vegan protein shake?
faqs.a: Around 120-150 kcal per serving with plant-based powder and water; higher with nut milk.

faqs.q: Does the brand affect calories in protein shakes?
faqs.a: Yes—flavored or mass-gainer types can add 50-200 extra kcal from carbs and sugars.
